flashcards.english: Kuuga mbu (humming sound), Kûhuha mîruri (whistle), Kûgamba (crow like rooster), Kûnegena (chirp), Kwarîia (bark), Gûkaya (meow), Kûina (bellow like bull)
flashcards.notes: Practice conjugating these 7 sound-making verbs in past tense. Each verb represents a specific animal or natural sound in Kikuyu

flashcards.english: I am here (Ndĩ gûkũ), You are here (Wĩ gûkũ), He/She is here (E gûkũ / Arĩ gûkũ), We are here (Twĩ gûkũ), You all are here (Mwĩ gûkũ), They are here (Me gûkũ / Marĩ gûkũ)
flashcards.notes: Present tense location pattern showing all person conjugations. 'Gûkũ' means 'here'. Pattern applies to all location words (haarĩa = there-near, kûrĩa = there-far)
